column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*From within the EU: COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Liechtenstein. Travellers do not have to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result. To learn more, please consult the travel rules for Switzerland.

*Transit:

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Liechtenstein and the usual transit rules apply. Travellers do not have to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result. 

To learn more, please consult the travel rules for Switzerland.



*From Third Countries:

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Liechtenstein. Travellers do not have to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result. 

To learn more, please consult the travel rules for Switzerland.


______________________

You can find the latest information on air travel regulations for this country on the IATA website.

You can also find information about your passenger rights on our portal for citizens.

Documents you need to travel in Europe
Health cover for temporary stays



Internal Restrictions:
*COVID-19 restrictions: Liechtenstein has lifted all COVID-19 pandemic restrictions â€“ there are no social distancing or mask wearing measures in place. There is no mandatory isolation requirement if you test positive for COVID-19. Local restrictions or mandatory mask wearing and proof of vaccination may be in place in hospitals or care homes. Within Liechtenstein, there is no certificate requirement at the national level.
